Key Match Events: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game.
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double.
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam, but it was ruled a two-run double after review.
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid during a three-run fourth inning for the Twins.
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season among three hits.
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer for Los Angeles.
Jhoan Duran secured his 23rd save despite surrendering three hits in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli commented on the team's good energy and locked-in performance.
Jordyn Adams reflected on his first career homer, emphasizing his focus on getting the ball in play.
Jack Kochanowicz mentioned needing to improve his breaking balls despite feeling good overall.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Angels' INF Brandon Drury left the game with left hamstring tightness.
Angels' OF Bryce Teodosio sustained a small finger fracture but is expected to avoid the injured list.
Twins' OF Byron Buxton will be activated from the 10-day injured list prior to Friday's game against Cincinnati.
Twins' OF Manuel Margot was reinstated from the injured list after missing 10 games.
Twins' C Christian Vázquez was reinstated from the paternity list.
Twins' C Jaír Camargo and utility player Michael Helman were optioned to Triple-A.
